artefact.overview: You may need to tell DVLA if you've had retinal treatment - download the correct form if you need to let them know
artefact.body:
You may need to tell DVLA if you’ve had retinal treatment.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical treatment or condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

If you’ve had retinal treatment in one eye

You don’t need to tell DVLA.

If you’ve had retinal treatment in both eyes

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form V1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘V1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 253KB)

Bus, coach or lorry driving licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form V1V and send it to the address on the form.

Download ‘V1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 261KB)
